content.raw: Right, the discussion about handsim latency is why I brought up the idea of parameterizing this value: in case we want to vary it in a future latency experiment, or if we find that we need to speed up the update rate to meet our goal for latency. But if 30Hz is the optimal rendering rate, then it might not be worth parameterizing it and we can look for optimizations in other parts of the system.
content.html: Right, the discussion about handsim latency is why I brought up the idea of parameterizing this value: in case we want to vary it in a future latency experiment, or if we find that we need to speed up the update rate to meet our goal for latency. But if 30Hz is the optimal rendering rate, then it might not be worth parameterizing it and we can look for optimizations in other parts of the system.
